item.title: Salali, G.D, et al. (2016) Knowledge-sharing networks in hunter-gatherers and the evolution of cumulative culture. Current Biology
item.description: Citation Salali, G.D., Chaudhary, N., Thompson, J., Grace, O.M., Burgt, X.M. van der, Dyble, M., Page, A.E., Smith, D., Lewis, J., Mace, R., Vinicius, L., Migliano, A.B. (2016) Knowledge-sharing networks in hunter-gatherers and the evolution of cumulative culture. Current Biology, 26 (18): 2516-2521. Abstract Humans possess the unique ability for cumulative culture. It has been argued that hunter-gathererâ€™s complex social structure has facilitated the evolution of cumulative culture by allowing information exchange among large pools of individuals.
